properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 3 at 3:49AM EST until March 4 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Caribou ME
properties.description:
* WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of
3 to 6 inches and ice accumulations up to one tenth of an inch
expected. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph Wednesday
afternoon.

* WHERE...Northeast Aroostook County.

* WHEN...From midnight tonight to 4 PM EST Wednesday. Mixed
precipitation expected midnight to about 8 AM EST
Wednesday...then becoming all snow.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of
blowing snow Wednesday afternoon could significantly reduce
visibility and cause localized hazardous travel. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning commute.
properties.instruction:
A Winter Weather Advisory means that periods of snow, sleet or
freezing rain will cause travel difficulties. Expect slippery
roads and limited visibilities, and use caution while driving.

The latest road conditions for Maine can be obtained by going to
newengland511.org.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 4 PM EST WEDNESDAY
